functional.notes: Guardrails enforce governance invariants and fail with actionable guidance.
findings: Guardrails check generated markdown frontmatter, requirements tracking discipline, intent/task wiring, and newer governance invariants (runbooks, path scope, prompt ACTIVITY footer).

correctness_safety.notes: Guardrails are trust-first: they fail loudly with fix guidance instead of silently allowing drift.
findings: Violations produce targeted, actionable error codes/messages.

performance.notes: Designed for CI-style use (single-process node, bounded scanning with directory skips).
findings: Skips large folders like node_modules; scans only relevant file extensions for REQ tags.

security.notes: Validation only reads the local repository; no untrusted command execution.

maintainability.notes: Guardrails logic is covered by unit tests and organized by validation domain.
findings: Tests cover generated surfaces and new invariants (e.g., intent path scope, prompt footer presence).

summary.notes: Guardrails are effective and test-backed; opportunity remains to tighten prompt footer validation semantics.
